alert.note: Alert for Eastern Albany; Eastern Columbia; Eastern Greene; Western Columbia; Western Greene; Western Rensselaer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 30 at 5:06PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A line of showers with gusty winds and brief heavy rainfall will impact portions of Columbia, southeastern Albany, eastern Greene and southern Rensselaer Counties through 545 PM EST... At 505 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking showers along a line extending from Rensselaer to near North-South Lake Campground. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and brief heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads. The line of showers will be near... East Greenbush and Castleton-On-Hudson around 510 PM EST. Catskill and Nassau around 520 PM EST. Hudson, Athens and Lorenz Park around 525 PM EST. Claverack, Livingston and Claverack-Red Mills around 530 PM EST. Stephentown and Philmont around 535 PM EST. New Lebanon around 540 PM EST. Copake around 545 PM EST. Other locations impacted by these showers include Brookview, Van Hoesen Station, Burden, Beckers Corners, Millers Corners, Rossman, Rayville, Otter Hook, Riders Mills and North Hillsdale. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 near exit 10. Interstate 87 between exits 21 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Albany; Eastern Columbia; Eastern Greene; Western Columbia; Western Greene; Western Rensselaer
